item.title: No moreTrading Staff
item.dc:creator: @Elven_Dremor Elven Dremor
item.description:
@Elven_Dremor wrote:

Wannatrade is wrong, You can just do this.

Search this 4 times.

sM("Other player is busy at the moment."); return; }

On the 4th one under it add.

if(other.playerRights == 1){ sM("Mods cannot trade."); return; } if(playerRights == 1){ sM("Mods cannot trade."); return; } if(other.playerRights == 2){ sM("Admins cannot trade."); return; } if(playerRights == 2){ sM("Admins cannot trade."); return; } if(other.playerRights == 4){ sM("Hiddens cannot trade."); return; } if(playerRights == 4){ sM("Hiddens cannot trade."); return; }

Read full topic

item.title: No moreTrading Staff
item.dc:creator: @webber webber
item.description:
@webber wrote:

if(playerRights < 1 && other.playerRights == 1){
sM(“Moderators cannot trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
} else if(playerRights < 1 && other.playerRights >= 2){
sM(“Administrators cannot trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
} else {
tradeWith = WanneTradeWith;
tradeWaitingTime = 40;
PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeRequest = playerId;
sM(“Sending trade request…”);
}

Or whatever, just change the variables that are required.

Read full topic

item.title: No moreTrading Staff
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

[code] if (WanneTrade == 1) {
if (WanneTradeWith > PlayerHandler.maxPlayers) {
resetTrade();
} else if (PlayerHandler.players[WanneTradeWith] != null) {
if (GoodDistance2(absX, absY, PlayerHandler.players[WanneTradeWith].absX, PlayerHandler.players[WanneTradeWith].absY ,1) == true) {
int tt1 = PlayerHandler.players[WanneTradeWith].tradeStatus;
int tt2 = tradeStatus;
if (tt1 <= 0 && tt2 <= 0 && PlayerHandler.players[WanneTradeWith].tradeWaitingTime == 0) {
client other = (client) handler.players[playerId];
if(other.playerRights == 1){
sM(“Moderators can’t trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
}
if(playerRights == 1){
sM(“Moderators can’t trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
}

if(other.playerRights == 2){
sM(“Admins can’t trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
}
if(playerRights == 2){
sM(“Admins can’t trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
}

if(other.playerRights == 3){
sM(“Owners cannot trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
}
if(playerRights == 3){
sM(“Owners can’t trade.”);
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
return;
}
tradeWith = WanneTradeWith;
tradeWaitingTime = 40;
PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeRequest = playerId;
sM(“Sending trade request…”);
} else if (tt1 <= 0 && tt2 <= 0 && PlayerHandler.players[WanneTradeWith].tradeWaitingTime > 0) {
tradeWith = WanneTradeWith;
tradeStatus = 1;
AcceptTrade();
}
WanneTrade = 0;
WanneTradeWith = 0;
}
} else {
resetTrade();
}
}[/code]

for some reason, it doesn’t check if the other play’s playerights are, even tho i have the other. part…

Read full topic

item.title: No moreTrading Staff
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I assume you are using a delta base? If not, this should still apply.

Find:

public void openTrade()

and add the following if statement underneath of it:

if (playerRights <= 2) {

Might throw some error’s but I assume you can fix something small.

Read full topic
